meanings.definition: The complete set of genes or genetic material present in a cell or organism.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the genom of different species to understand their genetic makeup.
meanings.sent2: The genom of a human consists of thousands of genes.
meanings.sent3: The genom of the fruit fly decided its eye color, making it a fashionable insect.
meanings.sent4: The genom of the plant whispered secrets of its resilience to the gardener.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the genom of a virus revealed its ability to mutate rapidly.

meanings.definition: The total genetic content contained in an individual.
meanings.sent1: Each person's genom is unique, like a genetic fingerprint.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the genom of a patient can help in diagnosing genetic disorders.
meanings.sent3: The genom of the cat made it a master of stealth, sneaking up on unsuspecting prey.
meanings.sent4: The genom of the tree held the history of the forest within its rings.
meanings.sent5: Examining the genom of a fish unveiled its adaptation to its underwater habitat.
